content.raw:
One thing to note about this approach is it might serialize data without needing to.

If we have `0` remote subscribers and `N` raw subscribers where none of those raw subscribers are listening for this message type, then we will end up serializing the message without needing to. The original implementation, on the other hand, ensured that serialization never happened unless it was strictly necessary.

If we consider that to be a micro-optimization that is not worth the additional code complexity, then I have no problem with switching to this simplified implementation. I just want to make sure that we're aware of the trade-offs.
content.html:
One thing to note about this approach is it might serialize data without needing to.

If we have 0 remote subscribers and N raw subscribers where none of those raw subscribers are listening for this message type, then we will end up serializing the message without needing to. The original implementation, on the other hand, ensured that serialization never happened unless it was strictly necessary.

If we consider that to be a micro-optimization that is not worth the additional code complexity, then I have no problem with switching to this simplified implementation. I just want to make sure that we're aware of the trade-offs.

content.raw:
It seems like we're getting some compilation errors after merge 158c0d2. In particular, I don't think we wanted to [change the signature of this function](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/commits/158c0d26d8cf9aed88d4be228ac399ec65b7b840?at=Default_RawPublishSubscribe#Linclude/ignition/transport/NodeShared.hhF80T74) nor [remove the DeallocFunc typedef](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/commits/158c0d26d8cf9aed88d4be228ac399ec65b7b840?at=Default_RawPublishSubscribe#Linclude/ignition/transport/TransportTypes.hhF167).

I'll create a branch that splits off of the parent changeset and see about resolving these.
content.html:
It seems like we're getting some compilation errors after merge 158c0d2. In particular, I don't think we wanted to change the signature of this function nor remove the DeallocFunc typedef.

I'll create a branch that splits off of the parent changeset and see about resolving these.

content.raw:
I've created the [Default_RawPublishSubscribe_nate_conflicts](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/branch/Default_RawPublishSubscribe_nate_conflicts?dest=Default_RawPublishSubscribe_nate#diff) branch to resolve these issues. I can create a PR for it, but I think it would be easier and faster to just merge it directly into this PR if you're okay with that.

I also created the [Default_RawPublishSubscribe_nate_OnlyZeroCopy](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/branch/Default_RawPublishSubscribe_nate_OnlyZeroCopy?dest=Default_RawPublishSubscribe_nate_conflicts#diff) which builds off of the other one by removing the version of `NodeShared::Publish` that uses `std::string` for messages. I think having a single `NodeShared::Publish` will help with long-term maintainability. I can also merge that branch into this one if you would like.

Once one or both of those branches are merged into this one, I'll be ready to approve.
content.html:
I've created the Default_RawPublishSubscribe_nate_conflicts branch to resolve these issues. I can create a PR for it, but I think it would be easier and faster to just merge it directly into this PR if you're okay with that.

I also created the Default_RawPublishSubscribe_nate_OnlyZeroCopy which builds off of the other one by removing the version of NodeShared::Publish that uses std::string for messages. I think having a single NodeShared::Publish will help with long-term maintainability. I can also merge that branch into this one if you would like.

Once one or both of those branches are merged into this one, I'll be ready to approve.

content.raw: I think since the destination branch is another feature branch with an open pull request it would be fine to merge your changes into this one, then right away merge this PR. Any issues with the changes made should be caught by reviewers of the destination branch's PR.
